ModuleDescription: This course offers an introduction to the main debates and issues in the field of regulation covering current debates about what regulation is, and the different institutions and instruments used to regulate our lives. It looks at (i) central concepts used by regulators, e.g. risk, cost-benefit analysis, regulatory impact assessment; (ii) when different strategies should be adopted in regulating a sector; (iii) three central fields where regulation is used â€“ competition, network industries, cyberspace. This course involves examples from jurisdictions across the world (especially Australasia, Europe and North America) with their insights having particular relevance for law and regulation in Singapore.
Prerequisite: NUS Compulsory Core Law Curriculum or equivalent.
